Disruption.comments: Various road restrictions in the Victoria area as part of the continuing Victoria Station Upgrade works and the Victoria Circle development. Wilton Road is closed to all traffic except buses and taxis, diversions are in place. Allington Street is also closed. Delays are possible in the Victoria area, especially at peak times.
Disruption.currentUpdate: Due to two ongoing major engineering projects (the Victoria Station Upgrade and the Victoria Circle Development), there are numerous restrictions in place around the Victoria one-way system at present, as follows: Allington Street is closed; Buckingham Palace Road is reduced to two lanes on approach to Victoria Street; Victoria Street is reduced to one lane eastbound between Bressenden Place and Westminster Cathedral; Victoria Street also has various lane restrictions in place westbound between Bressenden Place and Buckingham Palace Road; Wilton Road is restricted to buses, taxis and cycles north of Neathouse Place and reduced to one lane approaching Terminus Place; Hudson's Place is restricted to taxis only; and Bressenden Place is reduced to two narrow lanes southbound on approach to Victoria Street. In addition, there are various lane restrictions in place on Eccleston Bridge at its junction with Bullied Way to facilitate traffic signal upgrade work; and on Buckingham Palace Road at Eccleston Bridge due to telecoms works (see separate entries). Traffic is moving well in the area.
